page.title: 01Our Area
page.content: Our area is situated on the eastern bank of the River Trent about twenty miles from where it enters the Humber Estuary.Most of the area is arable farmland,growing crops like oil-seed rape and sugar-beet.The area includes the village of Morton,where our school is and the northern half of the town of Gainsborough.Morton has a population of 1,230,Gainsborough one of about 17,000. The underlying soil is clay with deposits of sand and alluvial silt,known locally as "warp".The main local industries produce packaging, ,wallpaper,tractors and shelving systems.Unemployment is quite high because of the decline in agricultural engineering.There are many social problems in the area,including vandalism and burglary,committed by the young unemployed.
